alert.note: Alert for Iroquois (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 27 at 7:56PM CST until March 02 at 8:24PM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois...Indiana... Des Plaines River near Gurnee affecting Lake IL County. Iroquois River at Iroquois affecting Newton and Iroquois Counties. Des Plaines River near Des Plaines affecting Cook County. Des Plaines River near Russell affecting Lake IL County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Iroquois River from Near US-41 downstream to confluence with Sugar Creek at Watseka, including the Iroquois gauge. * WHEN...Until Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Agricultural areas near the river begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CST Monday the stage was 18.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.3 feet Tuesday evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: These forecasts are based on observed precipitation as well as forecast precipitation 48 hours into the future. Changes to the rainfall forecast, or any additional rainfall after 48 hours, may cause changes to these river forecasts. A Flood Warning means water levels above flood stage are imminent or may already be occurring. Persons along rivers and streams in the warned area should take immediate precautions to protect life and property. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/Chicago and water.weather.gov The next statement is expected by Tuesday afternoon.
